meanings.definition: To carry or drag something with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: I had to schlep my heavy backpack up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She always schlep her groceries from the store to her apartment.
meanings.sent3: I schlep my laundry to the laundromat every weekend.
meanings.sent4: He schlep his tired body through the last mile of the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to schlep the heavy equipment across the construction site.

meanings.definition: A tedious or difficult journey or task.
meanings.sent1: The long schlep to the top of the mountain was worth the view.
meanings.sent2: She dreaded the schlep to the airport in rush hour traffic.
meanings.sent3: The daily schlep to work on crowded buses was exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The schlep through the muddy field felt never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The students complained about the schlep of carrying heavy textbooks all day.
